HandlingTool Operations
and Programming
  • FANUC CERT HandlingTool Operations and Programming course (32 hours)
  • $3,200 per participant
    $5,000 compared to FANUC pricing
  • This course covers the tasks that an operator, technician, engineer or programmer who needs to setup, record and/or troubleshoot programs on a FANUC Robotics HandlingTool Software Package.
  • All participants need to complete eLearn course online before they attend class. This should take approximately 30 hours.
  • Participants will then attend class Mon - Thursday for hands on learning and application. This should take approximately 32 hours.
  • Friday’s class is on site if needed This includes roboguide where participants will write a program and submit for review. This should take about 10 hours.
2D
iRVision
  • Day 1
  • Safety, Robot System, Teach Pendant
    Power Up, Jogging, & Initial Setup, Error and Fault Recovery
  • Day 2
  • Frames, Motion Program, Motion Instructions
    Copying and Editing Programs, Instructions - Branching
  • Day 3
  • Instructions - Position Register & Miscellaneous
    Inputs & Outputs
  • Day 4
  • Macros, Program Adjust
    Program and File Manipulation, Post-Test
  • Day 5
  • Roboguide - simulation, setting up a cell, like R&D
    The outcome is a completed written program.
HandlingTool Operations
and Programming
  • FANUC CERT 2D iRVision Operation and Programming (24 hours)
  • $2,400 per participant
    $4,000 compared to FANUC pricing
  • This course covers the basic tasks and procedures required for an operator, technician, engineer or programmer to set up, teach, test, and modify iRVision applications.
  • All participants need to complete the FANUC CERT HandlingTool Operations and Programming course before they are eligible to participate in this course. This should take approximately 32 hours.
  • Participants will then attend class Mon - Weds for hands on learning and application. This should take approximately 24 hours.
2D
iRVision
  • Day 1
  • Safety; Pre-Test Operating Procedures;
    R-30iB iRVision Overview
    Hardware and software installation; Camera Setup;
    Inspection Vision Process
  • Day 2
  • Vision System Concepts, Lighting, and Mastering;
    Tool Frames; Offset Frame
    Calibration GRID FRAME, Four Point Method
  • Day 3
  • 2D Calibration
    Single-View Vision Process; Post-Test

Maximum enrollment per class is 8 students. So reserve your spot now!

Register Now

All classes will be held at CF’s Ocala Campus located at 3001 S.W. College Road, Ocala, FL 34474. The drop, transfer and/or refund deadline is four (4) business days prior to the first day of class, no exceptions.

HOW IT WORKS

Step 1

eLearn

eLearn is the knowledge piece. It’s an online piece that takes anywhere from 30-40 hours to get through, and typically students would be given access to it so they can complete it online on their own ahead of class time.

Step 2

Classroom

Classroom is the application piece. This is taught in-class with an instructor and runs about 32 hours. This is where they receive hands-on practice on the robot.

Step 3

RoboGuide

RoboGuide is the simulation piece and takes anywhere from 4-8 hours to complete. This is where students can set up a cell, for example. Roboguide will be covered on the 5th day of the classroom training, or it can be done on-site at their facility if the facility owns the software license. After completing the Roboguide segment, students will have a program.

All three parts together can take between 70-80 hours depending on the size of the class, their experience levels, their language ability, knowledge with computers, etc.

Students will need access to a computer or laptop (laptops are best) and the appropriate software.

Benefits of taking this course at College of Central Florida!

Participants will be able to program faster and smarter; they’ll have better and faster troubleshooting abilities, which will result in more efficient programming, saving time; they’ll have improved programming techniques. They will develop formal understanding of FANUC robots; knowledge of why the robot behaves the way it does; ability to successfully troubleshoot the equipment.

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING

~ Steve Ulbrik

Sr. Research Engineer

I found the FANUC Handling Tool Operations and Programming Certification offered through the College of Central Florida to be a well delivered curriculum that not only addressed the academic requirements of the certification, but supplemented the curriculum with hands-on application. I find that I learn best by doing. Having the teach pendant in-hand during the lessons was a huge aid in becoming comfortable with the robot and in working with its many complex functions.

~ Frank Boria

Sr. Research Engineer
